name: bed
content:
bed noun
(FURNITURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 [ C or U ] a large, rectangular piece of furniture, often with four legs, used for sleeping on: He lived in a room with only two chairs, a bed, and a table. He likes to have breakfast in bed on a Saturday morning. She didn't get out of bed till lunchtime today. I'm exhausted - I'm going to bed (= going to get into a bed in order to sleep). I always put the children to bed (= make certain that they get into a bed and are comfortable there ready for going to sleep) at 7.30 p.m.
creativesunday2016/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages make the bed
B2 to make a bed neat after you have slept in it: I got up, dressed, made the bed and left.
